curriculumStandard: New York State K-12 Social Studies Framework - Grade 10: Global History and Geography II
curriculumFocus: World history from approximately 1750 to the present, including revolutions, industrialization, imperialism, world wars, Cold War, and contemporary global issues

topics.name: Absolute Monarchies
topics.description: European absolute monarchs and centralized power in the 17th-18th centuries

media.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
media.relevance: Set during Louis XIV's reign; shows Versailles court
media.notes: Leonardo DiCaprio; good depiction of French court life

media.title: Marie Antoinette
media.relevance: Sofia Coppola film on French queen; shows absolute monarchy excess
media.notes: PG-13; beautiful Versailles visuals; leads into French Revolution

media.title: Versailles (TV Series)
media.relevance: BBC drama about Louis XIV building Versailles
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; teacher reference on absolute monarchy

media.title: Peter the Great (1986)
media.relevance: NBC miniseries on Peter the Great's reign
media.notes: Maximilian Schell; comprehensive look at Russian absolutism

topics.name: Age of Enlightenment
topics.description: Philosophical movement emphasizing reason, individual rights, and scientific method

media.title: The Enlightenment
media.relevance: Documentary covering Enlightenment philosophers and ideas
media.notes: Covers major thinkers and their influence

media.title: Dangerous Liaisons
media.relevance: Shows aristocratic French society before Revolution
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; depicts pre-revolutionary French elite

media.title: Liberty! The American Revolution
media.relevance: PBS documentary showing Enlightenment ideas in action
media.notes: 6-part series; shows how Enlightenment influenced American founders

topics.name: American Revolution
topics.description: Colonial rebellion and creation of the United States

media.title: Hamilton
media.relevance: Lin-Manuel Miranda musical covering Hamilton and American Revolution
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging musical; some language

media.title: John Adams
media.relevance: HBO miniseries on John Adams and founding era
media.notes: Paul Giamatti; excellent for understanding founding era

media.relevance: Musical depicting Continental Congress and Declaration
media.notes: G-rated; engaging way to learn about Declaration debates

topics.name: French Revolution
topics.description: Overthrow of the French monarchy, Reign of Terror, and rise of Napoleon

media.title: Les Misérables
media.relevance: Musical set in post-revolutionary France and 1832 uprising
media.notes: Actually depicts later period but captures revolutionary spirit; Hugh Jackman

media.title: A Tale of Two Cities
media.relevance: Dickens adaptation set during French Revolution
media.notes: Classic adaptation; shows Terror period

media.title: The French Revolution
media.notes: Can be shown in segments; detailed coverage

media.title: Napoleon (2023)
media.relevance: Ridley Scott epic on Napoleon's rise and fall
media.notes: R-rated; spectacular visuals; teacher reference for Napoleon era

media.title: Napoleon
media.notes: 4 parts; comprehensive look at Napoleon's life and impact

topics.name: Latin American Independence
topics.description: Independence movements in Latin America led by figures like Bolivar and San Martin

media.title: Libertador
media.notes: R-rated; Spanish language; select scenes may work

media.title: The Other Conquest
media.relevance: Mexican film about conquest from indigenous perspective
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; Spanish language

media.title: Égalité for All: Toussaint Louverture and the Haitian Revolution
media.notes: Covers first successful slave revolution

topics.name: Industrialization
topics.description: Industrial Revolution, technological changes, and social impacts

media.title: Oliver Twist
media.relevance: Dickens adaptation showing industrial England poverty
media.notes: Roman Polanski version; shows workhouses and poverty

media.title: North and South
media.relevance: BBC adaptation of Gaskell novel set in industrial England
media.notes: 4-part series; shows factories, labor conditions, class tensions

media.title: The Victorian Slum
media.relevance: BBC documentary recreating Victorian slum conditions
media.notes: 5-part series; shows real conditions of industrial era poor

media.title: The Men Who Built America
media.relevance: History Channel series on industrial tycoons
media.notes: 8 parts; covers Carnegie, Rockefeller, Morgan, Ford

media.title: Newsies
media.relevance: Disney musical about newsboy strike showing child labor
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging introduction to labor issues

topics.name: Nationalism and Imperialism
topics.description: Rise of nationalism and European imperial expansion

media.title: The Young Victoria
media.relevance: Depicts Queen Victoria's early reign during imperial expansion
media.notes: PG; Emily Blunt; shows Victorian era Britain

media.title: Victoria & Abdul
media.relevance: Victoria's friendship with Indian servant; shows British imperialism
media.notes: Judi Dench; shows late Victorian Britain-India relations

topics.name: Scramble for Africa
topics.description: European colonization and partition of Africa

media.title: Hotel Rwanda
media.notes: PG-13; powerful but intense; shows colonialism's lasting effects

media.title: Out of Africa
media.relevance: Colonial Kenya through European settler's eyes
media.notes: PG; Meryl Streep; shows colonial Africa

media.title: King Leopold's Ghost
media.notes: Disturbing content but important; covers Congo exploitation

media.title: Africa's Great Civilizations
media.relevance: Henry Louis Gates Jr. documentary including colonial era
media.notes: Episode 5-6 cover colonial period and resistance

topics.name: Imperialism in Asia
topics.description: European and American imperialism in India, China, and Southeast Asia

media.title: Gandhi
media.relevance: Epic biography of Gandhi and Indian independence movement
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Academy Award winner; Ben Kingsley

media.title: A Passage to India
media.relevance: David Lean film set in British India
media.notes: Shows British-Indian relations and colonialism

media.title: The Last Emperor
media.relevance: Academy Award winner about China's last emperor
media.notes: Beautiful; covers end of Chinese empire through WWII

media.title: 55 Days at Peking
media.notes: Charlton Heston; shows Western imperialism in China

media.title: The Opium War
media.relevance: Chinese film on First Opium War
media.notes: Chinese perspective on British imperialism

topics.name: The Great War
topics.description: Causes, course, and consequences of World War I
subtopics: Alliance system - Triple Entente vs Central Powers

media.title: War Horse
media.relevance: Spielberg WWI film following a horse through the war
media.notes: PG-13; emotional but appropriate; shows WWI from unique perspective

media.relevance: Single-shot style WWI trench warfare film
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; stunning visuals for teacher reference

media.title: They Shall Not Grow Old
media.relevance: Peter Jackson restored and colorized WWI footage
media.notes: R-rated; powerful restored footage; select scenes may work

media.title: The Great War
media.notes: Classic documentary; comprehensive; select relevant episodes

media.title: Paths of Glory
media.relevance: Kubrick anti-war film set in WWI French army
media.notes: Kirk Douglas; shows futility of war; anti-war message

media.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
media.notes: R-rated; excellent German perspective; select scenes

media.title: Sergeant York
media.relevance: Classic about WWI hero Alvin York
media.notes: Gary Cooper; shows American experience in WWI

topics.name: Russian Revolution
topics.description: Bolshevik Revolution, creation of the Soviet Union, and rise of communism

media.title: Anastasia
media.relevance: Animated film about Russian Revolution's impact
media.notes: G-rated; fictional but good starting point for discussion

media.title: Doctor Zhivago
media.relevance: Epic spanning Russian Revolution and Civil War
media.notes: David Lean epic; Omar Sharif; shows revolutionary era

media.title: Reds
media.relevance: Warren Beatty film about John Reed witnessing Russian Revolution
media.notes: PG; American journalist's perspective on revolution

media.title: The Russian Revolution
media.notes: Made for 100th anniversary; comprehensive coverage

topics.name: Rise of Totalitarianism
topics.description: Fascism in Italy, Nazism in Germany, and militarism in Japan
subtopics: Hitler and Nazi rise to power

media.title: The Great Dictator
media.relevance: Charlie Chaplin satire of Hitler and fascism
media.notes: G-rated; Chaplin's famous anti-fascist speech

media.title: Triumph of the Will
media.relevance: Nazi propaganda film - for analyzing propaganda techniques
media.notes: PROPAGANDA - show clips ONLY for analysis; discuss manipulation

media.title: The Rise of Evil
media.relevance: CBS miniseries on Hitler's rise to power
media.notes: Robert Carlyle; shows how Hitler came to power

media.title: The World at War
media.relevance: Classic documentary series; episodes on rise of fascism
media.notes: Laurence Olivier narrates; select relevant episodes

topics.name: Second World War
topics.description: Global conflict, the Holocaust, and Allied victory

media.title: Dunkirk
media.relevance: Christopher Nolan film on Dunkirk evacuation
media.notes: PG-13; intense but minimal graphic violence; shows British resilience

media.title: Saving Private Ryan
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; D-Day landing sequence for reference

media.title: The Longest Day
media.relevance: Classic D-Day film from multiple perspectives
media.notes: G-rated; all-star cast; comprehensive D-Day coverage

media.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
media.relevance: Pearl Harbor attack from both Japanese and American perspectives
media.notes: G-rated; shows both sides of Pearl Harbor

media.title: Midway
media.relevance: Battle of Midway - turning point in Pacific
media.notes: PG-13; modern effects; shows Pacific Theater

media.title: The World at War
media.notes: 26 episodes; Laurence Olivier narrates; comprehensive

media.title: WWII in HD
media.relevance: History Channel series with restored color footage
media.notes: 10 parts; color footage makes war more real

topics.name: The Holocaust
topics.description: Genocide of European Jews and other groups by Nazi Germany

media.title: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
media.notes: PG-13; age-appropriate introduction; emotionally powerful

media.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
media.relevance: Classic adaptation of Anne Frank's diary
media.notes: Academy Award winner; excellent for this topic

media.title: Schindler's List
media.notes: R-rated; may be shown with parental permission; essential film

media.title: Life is Beautiful
media.relevance: Italian film about father protecting son in concentration camp
media.notes: PG-13; Roberto Benigni; Italian language; touching approach

media.title: The Pianist
media.relevance: True story of Jewish pianist surviving Warsaw Ghetto
media.notes: R-rated; Polanski; select scenes appropriate

media.title: Shoah
media.relevance: Landmark Holocaust documentary with survivor testimonies
media.notes: 9+ hours; extremely comprehensive; select segments

media.title: Night and Fog
media.relevance: Short documentary showing concentration camp footage
media.notes: Disturbing imagery; teacher discretion required

topics.name: Cold War
topics.description: Ideological conflict between capitalism and communism, proxy wars, and nuclear tensions

media.title: The Post
media.relevance: Pentagon Papers and Vietnam War secrets
media.notes: Spielberg; Meryl Streep, Tom Hanks; journalism during Vietnam

media.title: Thirteen Days
media.relevance: Cuban Missile Crisis from Kennedy administration perspective
media.notes: Kevin Costner; tense dramatization of nuclear crisis

media.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
media.relevance: Le Carré adaptation showing Cold War espionage
media.notes: Richard Burton; shows bleak reality of Cold War

media.title: Dr. Strangelove
media.relevance: Kubrick satire on nuclear war and Cold War paranoia
media.notes: PG; dark comedy about MAD doctrine

media.title: Bridge of Spies
media.relevance: Spielberg film on U-2 spy plane incident and prisoner exchange
media.notes: Tom Hanks; shows Cold War espionage and diplomacy

media.title: The Cold War
media.relevance: CNN 24-episode documentary on the Cold War
media.notes: Comprehensive; Kenneth Branagh narrates

topics.name: End of Empires
topics.description: Independence movements in Africa, Asia, and the Middle East

media.title: Gandhi
media.notes: PG; essential for decolonization unit

media.title: A Cry Freedom
media.relevance: Steve Biko and South African apartheid resistance
media.notes: Denzel Washington as Biko; shows apartheid

media.title: Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom
media.notes: Idris Elba; covers apartheid struggle

media.title: The Battle of Algiers
media.relevance: Algerian war of independence from France
media.notes: Italian neorealism; influential film on decolonization

media.title: Viceroy's House
media.notes: Shows traumatic partition of India and Pakistan

topics.name: Contemporary Global Issues
topics.description: Recent conflicts, terrorism, globalization, and international relations

media.title: The Fall of the Berlin Wall
media.relevance: Documentary on 1989 events and end of Cold War
media.notes: 30th anniversary documentary; covers collapse of communism

media.title: Zero Dark Thirty
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; teacher reference on War on Terror

media.title: Charlie Wilson's War
media.relevance: US support for Afghan mujahideen - origins of later conflicts
media.notes: R-rated; Tom Hanks; shows Cold War Afghanistan connection

topics.name: Human Rights Movements
topics.description: Civil rights movements, women's rights, and social justice globally

media.title: Selma
media.relevance: MLK and Selma voting rights marches
media.notes: Powerful depiction of civil rights struggle

media.title: 12 Years a Slave
media.notes: R-rated; powerful; may be shown with parental permission

media.title: Suffragette
media.notes: Carey Mulligan; shows suffragette struggle

media.title: Milk
media.notes: R-rated; Sean Penn; covers LGBTQ rights history

topics.name: Global Economics
topics.description: Capitalism, communism, and mixed economies in the modern world

media.title: The Big Short
media.notes: R-rated; excellent for understanding financial systems

media.title: Inside Job
media.notes: Academy Award winner; explains global economics

media.title: Inequality for All
media.relevance: Robert Reich documentary on economic inequality
media.notes: PG; accessible explanation of economic inequality

topics.name: Technological Change
topics.description: Impact of technology on society including digital revolution and communication

media.title: The Social Dilemma
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - relevant for students; good discussion starter

media.title: An Inconvenient Truth
media.relevance: Al Gore documentary on climate change
media.notes: PG; foundational climate change documentary

media.title: Steve Jobs
media.notes: R-rated; Michael Fassbender; shows tech revolution

media.title: The Imitation Game
media.relevance: Alan Turing and origins of computing
media.notes: Benedict Cumberbatch; shows origins of computer age

categories.name: Quick Clips & Educational Shorts
categories.description: Short-form educational content from YouTube, TED-Ed, Crash Course - perfect for Global History II

media.notes: Engaging overview

media.notes: Italy, fascist ideology

media.notes: D-Day to atomic bomb

media.notes: US-Soviet rivalry

media.title: Oversimplified: Cold War (Part 1)
media.notes: Origins through crises

media.notes: Vietnam through fall of USSR

media.notes: 13 days that changed world

topics.description: Short videos on globalization, terrorism, and contemporary issues

media.title: Crash Course World History: Globalization I
media.notes: Trade, culture, technology

media.notes: Modern terrorism context

media.notes: Historical methods
